aha!  one moment.
You used "export http_proxy=http://whateverproxy:proxyport"  in the same terminal where you're using apt-get?
`export | grep http_proxy`  results in `declare -x http_proxy="http://guest.hds.com:8080"`
pici: yes, both my user name and root have the proxy settings
Hm... You could try setting it directly in /etc/apt/apt.conf via Acquire::http::Proxy "http://yourproxyaddress:proxyport";
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/AptGet/Howto#APT_configuration_file_method may explain it better than I
so `Acquire::http::Proxy ...` on one line?
pici: headed to the doc now
worked great!
I'm up and running again. doing the updates now
